The claim was based on a comment made by: Gov. Rebecca Kleefisch during an event announcing a donation for science and math education by GE Foundation.
The source of the claim was identified a: which were based on a U.S. Department of Education summary of the 2009 Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA).
The PISA rankings do not include a combi: math ranking or a ranking of 29 countries. Instead, they assess science and math separately and provide rankings for 34 industrialized countries and 65 entities (60 countries plus five other educational systems).
The expert: s verdict confirmed that the U.S. ranked in the top half of industrialized countries in science and tied for 24th in math among the larger group of 65 entities.
